This is a real, growing #publichealth threat that needs to be addressed. This morning, I’m participating in a #SubOversight hearing at @HouseCommerce focusing on measles outbreaks in our country. WATCH LIVE >> https://energycommerce.house.gov/committee-activity/hearings/hearing-on-confronting-a-growing-public-health-threat-measles-outbreaks …

Indiana has been fortunate & has not had any cases reported this year, but #Hoosiers still run the risk of being exposed to such a disease. Measles vaccines have saved more than 20 million lives throughout the world since 2000.

Measles is a highly contagious, airborne virus that can lead to serious respiratory illnesses & can become life-threatening.  Just this year, there have been reports of 127 individual measles cases throughout 10 states.

Good morning, #IN05! After my interview with @WHBU, it was great to meet with a number of #Hoosier members of @IBAtweet  in my office to discuss the Local Radio Freedom Act. I’m a proud cosponsor of this #bipartisan bill because it supports our local radio stations & broadcasters pic.twitter.com/DEcujGjysK – at Rayburn House Office Building
I support the President’s national emergency declaration designed to strengthen our borders with additional border barrier systems as quickly and efficiently as possible.
There are already over 650 miles of barriers in place at the southern border. Apprehensions of people trying to illegally enter our country at these barrier locations have gone down dramatically.
Strong borders must be in place in order to keep the American people safe and the situation at our southern border can no longer be ignored.

While this is a humanitarian crisis that must be handled with compassion, this ongoing problem is overwhelming our resources to adequately address thousands upon thousands of people, particularly of children, who are coming to our border.

As I witnessed during my trip to the Texas border last year, we are seeing floods of families and unaccompanied children reaching our southern border in an attempt to illegally enter the Unites States.
The resolution the House passed today to end the President’s national emergency declaration undermines the statutory powers granted by Congress to the President to declare national emergencies.
Congress gave the President statutory authority to declare national emergencies. When Congress did so, they did not specifically define what can be designated as a ‘national emergency’ or not.

It is an incredible honor to receive @HopeAcademyRHS’s 2019 Faces of Hope Award. Together, we can work to overcome this substance abuse crisis & change the trajectory of a young person’s life for the better. pic.twitter.com/v2YYofsaAz

Teachers & staff at @HopeAcademyRHS are making a difference in the lives of students each & every day – they are on the front lines of the substance abuse crisis – & work helps kids struggling with substance abuse find a path forward. pic.twitter.com/OpSSLz0yuT
.@HopeAcademyRHS is the only recovery high school in Indiana. It’s one of only forty in the country.
Addiction is a disease but it wasn’t until recently that we started treating it like one. @HopeAcademyRHS is driving that change & it’s a national model that we must continue to promote & encourage.

This package works to improve our communities by improving our nation’s transportation infrastructure & ensuring rural areas have access to the same basic utilities that urban areas have through expanded deployment in #ruralbroadband.
It continues to ensure safe & healthy food on the tables of American families & funds federal crop insurance programs that provide much needed stability to #Hoosier farmers.
With this agreement, federal workers are provided the security they deserve in knowing they will get paid on time & receive a 1.9% pay raise.
What Congress passed today is more than just border security.

This deal increases the number of immigration judges so we can reduce the troubling case backlog. It builds safer communities by including resources for state/local law enforcement to address the #opioidcrisis, close sexual assault kit backlogs & hire more police officers.

It further combats terrorists, espionage, drug traffickers, gangs & violent criminals by increasing funding for U.S. Attorneys; U.S. Marshals; Drug Enforcement Administration; Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms & Explosives; & the Federal Bureau of Investigation.
This package provides over $22 billion for improved border security, including physical barriers, needed equipment, technology & personnel to keep our country safe.

It is government’s job to work together to fund the government & I am proud we were able make progress & find a #bipartisan compromise that keeps government open & provides necessary funding to better secure our southern border.
